definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: But though slightly drunk he was also suffering under some grief that was genuine and unbearable .
sentences.chinese: 不过他纵然略有醉意，却有着什么真切难忍的悲恸。

sentences.english: True and touching is the most important feature of emotional expression in female singers Ci.
sentences.chinese: 宋代歌妓词在情感表达上的最大特点是真切动人。

sentences.english: Amyand I were actually able to see our little girl's heart actually beating through the protective cover.
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫真切地看到孩子的心脏在保护罩下跳动。

sentences.english: It does slow you down but I was able to really see each flower.
sentences.chinese: 确实慢下脚步来，而我能够真切地观赏到每一朵花。

sentences.english: America's air and water and lands are measurably cleaner.
sentences.chinese: 美国的一山一水都真切地变得更为干净。

sentences.english: You'll get a real sense of the physical acts of painting when you look at this picture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在看画时能真切感受到熬作画时的张力。

sentences.english: Now we really want you to look at the images of how we live.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我们真切希望你们能看看我们是如何生活的。

sentences.english: To direct representations of words, accurate, can be Baimiao modification, real deep.
sentences.chinese: 要直接陈述，用字准确，可白描修饰，真切深刻。

sentences.english: We do hope that Cities XL has many more great years ahead of itself!
sentences.chinese: 我们真切希望特大城市能继续推广流行下去。

sentences.english: You did it because you understand the enormity of the task that lies on.
sentences.chinese: 你这样做，是因为你真切任务的艰巨性是摆在面前。

sentences.english: I truly know why there is music in leaves.
sentences.chinese: 我真切明了为什么叶间淌著音乐。

sentences.english: Some thought he must be dead, but none knew positively.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为他一定已经入土了，但没有人能说个真切。

sentences.english: Mike white murder after the collapse of the spirit of the process is to portray real delicate.
sentences.chinese: 麦克白杀人后精神崩溃的过程更是刻画得细腻真切。

sentences.english: The report is vividly written and very moving.
sentences.chinese: 这篇通讯写得真切感人。

sentences.english: Watch your kids and really see what they’re doing.
sentences.chinese: 观察你的孩子真切地看他们在做什么。

sentences.english: Genuine love and affection poured in from all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 人们对他真切的喜爱和情感从全国各地倾泻而来。

definition: (idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
body odor/to appreciate a subtle taste
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
